item.title: But whyyyyyyyy
item.description: GenX here. My wife and I weren't diagnosed with ADHD until we were 30 years old, but we have struggled all of our lives. So we're ahead of the curve. Wanted kids, but never felt financially secure enough. Definitely too late now, and still only marginally secure. Well, marginally insecure is probably a better description.

Automatic sewing machine.
Buttery smooth sealcoat.
Skilled tinning.
Cleaning an iPhone charging port.
Delivering a spider excavator by helicopter.

Fresh look for old furniture.
Hand-splitting traditional roof shingles in Romania.
If you're a fisherman and you've ever wondered how your reel works... Here's the answer.
Industrial Sewing Machine.

Making a barrel in the older days.
Meat cutting machine.

Physics at its finest.

Rotating cabinet hinge.
Salt skimmer.
Secure your fences quickly and effectively.

item.title: Meta Glasses Guy Mad at Woman he was Recording Who Snapped His Glasses in Half ...
item.description: “She just broke my Meta glasses,” said the TikTok user, who goes by eth8n, in a video ... “You’re going to be famous on the internet!” he shouted at her through the window after getting off the train. The accused woman, however, peered back at him completely unfazed, as if to say that he had it coming. But instead of coming to his support, the internet wholeheartedly rallied behind the alleged perpetrator, celebrating the woman as a folk hero — and perfectly highlighting how the public feels about gadgets like Meta’s smart glasses. While Meta built in a small LED light in the front of its glasses to indicate when it’s recording a video, it can easily be covered by a small piece of tape, making it trivially easy to spy on strangers in public without their knowledge or consent. As Daily Dot points out, people are even selling stickers for this specific purpose. In the meantime, eth8n claims to have “filed a claim with the police and it’s a misdemeanor charge.” “What she did was assault, can get arrested for it if I see her again and felt like it,” he wrote. https://futurism.com/future-society/woman-hero-smashing-meta-smart-glasses-subway

Ukraine generally tries to target empty tankers for many very good reasons I'm sure that a second of thought will reveal. Yes even an empty oil tanker is an environmental tragedy, and we all agree. item.title: Return of the Meme: 1547 (corridor cooking techniques)
item.description:
Let's get this bread.
I did. Not sleep well last night. Got distracted by a conversation in the discord about Whiptail lizards and then my allergies kicked up because I've been cleaning my apartment and so I couldn't breathe easily. Well, less easily than I normally can at night to begin with, lol. Which sucks because I have to leave in two hours to work at a wine festival in Tempe for a few hours. But it is work at least, for the weekend...
Okay, I dont relate to the LAST PART, but man, im suprised Pippin hasn't given me a nipple piercing at some point.
SPEAKING OF FEEDING RAVENS! I just read about a raven that was observed placing pieces of rat meat on live electrical wires in subzero temperatures, and actively shifting it's position. Ravens are learning to cook, or at least, warm their food.
I posted this before, but I really like it, so here it is again.
I do love me Iranian/Persian music. And music from the Balkans.
Ravens that know how to cook are the wave of the future.
Ever since I read this ridiculous tweet, I cant help but think of the Meme someone posted about a "man staring into you eyes as he slides it in" and its made checking out at the grocery store more entertaining.
The Raven who learned how to cook. Why is this a big thing to me, you ask? Most Paleoanthropologists agree that it was the start of making cooked foods that really Kickstarted the evolution of our larger brains, because it made the proteins easier to digest so more energy could be obtained.
Pippin tax! Today's message from Pippin: "okay." ______ 1) Are you on the run to a safe place and passing through Arizona on your way to safer grounds? My apartment is open to you to crash at, and it is a safe space. Pippin and I will make you a meal and gladly share tea, wine, or mead with you. 2) Hey! Take your meds with a full glass of water, please. Do it for Pippin, or Space Mom, or better yet, do it for yourself. 3) Ĝefeloað wē. We will carry on. 4) all funds from the sales of items at these two links will be sent to support charities aiding to fight for Trans rights in the US (not just T-shirts!) https://www.teepublic.com/t-shirt/74812801-all-conures-are-anarchists https://www.teepublic.com/t-shirt/74811778-whiptail-pride 5) Since multiple people have requested this over the last two weeks or so, my ko-fi is: https://ko-fi.com/codyandpippin 6) We now have a discord! https://discord.gg/cEGtpDN8
item.dc:creator: CodyBurkett

item.title: Awesome look into apology and accountability
item.description:
Gentleman made a slight at a video, caught some learning, explained without excusing, apologized with accountability. A change in direction is cooler to see than deflecting, excusing, minimizing. Not all disabilities are visible, and not all are apparent because we all have limited knowledge. We are learning everyday (hopefully). We can strive for everyone to be able to open bottles, however that looks like for us.
Bottle opener in question.
Visual on how mobility rings help us. Be kind, be better. Cheers

This act is just the start, soon enough nobody's going to be able to criticize the government without ending up in prison. You've been warned. /European
